item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 19, 2024 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Developing Developers (2015) (49 points | 8 comments)
2. Markov Keyboard: keyboard layout that changes by Markov frequency (91 points | 46 comments)
3. Solaar is a Linux manager for many Logitech keyboards, mice, and other devices (420 points | 177 comments)
4. Show HN: Postgres as a VectorDB GUI (91 points | 12 comments)
5. Firenvim – Turn the browser into a Neovim client (81 points | 15 comments)
6. Piccolo OS, a Small Multitasking OS for the Raspberry Pi Pico (97 points | 13 comments)
7. Blackmagic Debuts $30K 3D Camera for Capturing Video for Vision Pro (9 points | discuss)
8. ISO 8583: The language of credit cards (282 points | 49 comments)
9. Alignment faking in large language models (99 points | 72 comments)
10. Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in minimal intelligence (112 points | 34 comments)
11. Exposing the Clearingstelle Urheberrecht Im Internet (CUII) (83 points | 15 comments)
12. Borrow Checking, RC, GC, and Eleven Other Memory Safety Approaches (38 points | 14 comments)
13. Our brains create mental "chapters" with new event segmentation study (82 points | 3 comments)
14. Error Stacking in Rust (76 points | 27 comments)
15. Genesis – a generative physics engine for general-purpose robotics (57 points | 18 comments)
16. Updates to H-1B (347 points | 946 comments)

18. The RAM Myth (96 points | 64 comments)
19. Launch HN: Innate (YC F24) – Home robots as easy to program as AI agents (138 points | 62 comments)
20. Argentine rodents are Dubai oasis' newest residents (6 points | 2 comments)
21. Amazon workers to strike at multiple US warehouses during busy holiday season (90 points | 29 comments)
22. Analyzing the World Chess Championship 2024: Empirical synthesized approach (25 points | 26 comments)
23. There's No Such Thing as Software Productivity (2012) (89 points | 85 comments)
24. Half My Life with Perl (89 points | 47 comments)
25. Khalid Sheldrake: The East Dulwich man who would be King (34 points | 22 comments)
26. Embedding Lua in Sqleibniz with Rust (46 points | 1 comment)
27. Moon (2899 points | 238 comments)
28. Torpedo juice: Legendary, illegal WWII liquor drunk in Alaska and the world (46 points | 21 comments)
29. Windshield pitting incidents in Washington reach fever pitch on April 15, 1954 (2003) (286 points | 235 comments)
30. Formally Modeling Dreidel, the Sequel (90 points | 23 comments)
